meanings.sent1: The shakeup of the bottle mixed the ingredients well.
meanings.sent2: I gave the jar a shakeup to evenly distribute the contents.
meanings.sent3: The shakeup of the snow globe made the glitter swirl beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake was a powerful shakeup of the entire city.
meanings.sent5: The shakeup of the tambourine added a lively rhythm to the music.

meanings.definition: A sudden and drastic change or reorganization.
meanings.sent1: The company's shakeup led to new management taking over.
meanings.sent2: After the merger, there was a major shakeup in the organization.
meanings.sent3: The shakeup in the cafeteria menu surprised everyone with healthier options.
meanings.sent4: The political scandal caused a shakeup in the government's leadership.
meanings.sent5: The sudden shakeup in the team's lineup caught everyone off guard.
